intro: Hyperbaena salvadorensis, commonly known as the Salvadoran hyperbaena, is a flowering plant native to El Salvador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
